metadata.description: A collection of Claude Code plugins and skills

plugins.name: wayback
plugins.description: Wayback Machine Archive: Tools for checking, submitting, listing, screenshotting, and cache management for archived URLs

plugins.name: npm-registry
plugins.description: npm Registry: Tools for searching packages, getting metadata, checking existence, and fetching download statistics

plugins.name: pypi-json
plugins.description: PyPI JSON API: Tools for querying Python package metadata, release information, and statistics from the Python Package Index

plugins.name: gravatar
plugins.description: Gravatar Avatar URLs: Tools for generating avatar URLs from email addresses

plugins.name: github-api
plugins.description: GitHub REST API: Tools for repository metadata, READMEs, user profiles, and rate limit checking

plugins.name: npms-io
plugins.description: NPMS Package Analysis: Tools for package quality analysis, comparison, and name suggestions

plugins.name: cve-search
plugins.description: CVE Search: Tools for searching vulnerabilities by CVE ID, product name, or vendor, with detailed vulnerability information and dependency auditing

plugins.name: bib
plugins.description: Bibliography manipulation plugin supporting BibTeX, BibLaTeX, RIS, EndNote XML, and CSL JSON formats. Convert, validate, merge, filter, and perform CRUD operations on bibliography files.

plugins.name: tex
plugins.description: LaTeX manipulation, generation, and conversion tools

plugins.name: json-schema
plugins.description: JSON Schema Validation: Tools for validating JSON schemas themselves, validating JSON files against schemas, and auto-validating files against their $schema reference

plugins.name: json-lsp
plugins.description: JSON Language Server: Provides validation, completion, hover, document symbols, and formatting for JSON and JSONC files with automatic schema association support

plugins.name: json-tools
plugins.description: JSON file manipulation toolkit with query, transform, edit, validate, and format capabilities using TypeScript
